context: The Estonian word 'teen' is the first-person singular present form of the verb 'teema', which means 'to make' or 'to do'. In English, it translates to 'I make' or 'I do'. This is a very common and fundamental verb in Estonian used for expressing actions similar to 'make' and 'do' in English. The word changes its form depending on the subject (who is performing the action) and tense.
